Description: Neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; at top, two black bands, below, black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx or siren (only curl of wing and part of head with added red and red fillet remaining), to right; blob rosette with red as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 200, no. B1)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 143, fig. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0045) (Phase 1)
